de.unisiegen.tpml.core.util
Class AbstractEnvironment<S,E>

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.util.AbstractEnvironment<S,E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Environment<S,E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultStore, DefaultTypeEnvironment
public abstract class AbstractEnvironment<S,E>
extends Object
implements Environment<S,E>

Abstract implementation of the generic Environment interface.

Version:
$Rev: 277 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:

AbstractEnvironment

Creates a new environment, based on the mappings from the specified environment.

Parameters:

Throws:
NullPointerException - if the environment is null.
Method Detail

containsSymbol

public boolean containsSymbol(S symbol)
Returns true if this environment contains an entry for the specified symbol. Otherwise false is returned. The meaning of the symbol depends on the actual environment. For example, for stores, this is a Location, and for the the type environment, this is an identifier (a String).

Specified by:
containsSymbol in interface Environment<S,E>
Parameters:
symbol - the symbol to check.
Returns:
true if the environment contains an entry for the symbol, otherwise false.
See Also:
common.Environment#containsSymbol(S)

get

public E get(S symbol)
Returns the entry that is stored for the given symbol in this environment. Throws a NoSuchElementException if the symbol is invalid for this environment.

Specified by:
get in interface Environment<S,E>
Parameters:
symbol - the symbol for which to return the entry. See the description of the #containsSymbol(S) method for details about the symbol.
Returns:
the entry for the symbol.
See Also:
common.Environment#get(S)

put

protected void put(S symbol,
                   E entry)
Adds a new mapping from symbol to entry. Any previous mapping for symbol will be removed.

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol for the new mapping.
entry - the entry for the new mapping.
See Also:
#get(S)

symbols

public Enumeration<S> symbols()
Returns an enumeration of the symbols within this store, in the reverse order of the allocation. That is, the last inserted symbol is returned first.

Specified by:
symbols in interface Environment<S,E>
Returns:
an enumeration of the symbols. See the description of the #containsSymbol(S) method for details about the symbols.
See Also:
common.Environment#symbols()

toString

public String toString()
Returns the string representation for the mutable store. Should be used for debugging purpose only.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
the string representation.
See Also:
Object.toString()
